preqs: For students in the LLB Course:LAW3400 or LAW3401 and LAW3402For students in the LLB Hons course:Foundations of LawCriminal Law 1Public Law and Statutory InterpretationTortsContract AContract BProperty AConstitutional Law

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {LAW1102, LAW1104} or  Must have passed 6 (I/W) units in {LAW1112, LAW1113, LAW1114, LAW2102, LAW2111, LAW2112})
(Must be enrolled in course owned by {50000567} and For COURSE_CODE IN {L3%} Do Any 2 co-req units in {LAW3111, LAW3112} Otherwise true)

unitName: Patents, trade marks and unfair competition
description: This unit involves a detailed consideration of patent law, trade mark law and, to a lesser extent, the law of unfair competition. Students will be required to comprehend the development of patent law over time and analyse patent specifications and claims. They will also examine trade mark law and critically consider trade mark law principles and policies.
